Thanks for resolving this. We need EIL to be a button option on the Liability menu.

On the Liability Menu (Liability - Ocean Underwriting) can We can replace the words "Case Study" with "Environmental Impairment Liability" then put a button underneath that says "Learn More" and links to the EIL page that you have created.

full_threads.body:
Hi Elizabeth,

Could you please let us know how you would like the EIL page to be displayed from the Liability page?

Looking forward to your reply.

Hi Elizabeth,

I have reverted the Liability page and I'm currently working on the EIL page.

I'll get back to you once done.

Give me a call if easier to discuss - we can't have the Liability page down as this is the busiest week of the year for us leading up to end of fin year.

0452 067 587

Hi Rica - Just looking at the website, this page seems to have replace all of the Liability content - i.e when I click on Liability I am only taken to the EIL content.

We need to get this fixed ASAP pls

EIL should be a page that the user can view via the main liability page - I cant show you an example as the page has disappeared

full_threads.body:
Hi Elizabeth,

Hope you are doing well. 

This is to notify you that we received your request and we are already working on it. 

We will get back to you tomorrow once done.

@jaime could you please action the task below tomorrow? I'm done with the rest of the task, just need your help with this one:
—————*
Can you reduce the size of the animated graphic so that we can add the following copy:

New Section Copy:

EIL might suit your client if they:

Hold, store, or own property containing the following contaminants:

    • Asphyxiant, explosive and toxic gases (e.g. methane, helium, propane and nitrogen)
    • Contaminated effluent or stored wastewater from the manufacturing process
    • Flammable and combustible products and substances (e.g. diesel, petrol, ethanol and methylated spirit)
    • Fibres (e.g. asbestos and synthetic substances)
    • Inorganic products and compounds (hydrochloric acid, sulfuric acid and ammonium sulfate)
    • Metals (e.g lead, mercury and arsenic)
    • Manufacturing byproducts (inorganic)
    • Oils and tars
    • Pesticides and herbicides
    • Asphyxiant, explosive and toxic gases (e.g. methane, helium, propane and nitrogen)

Your client may be exposed to pollution risk from their location or from the business activities they undertake, for example:

    • Contaminated soil either existing or brought on to the site
    • Disturbance of unknown or often historical contamination
    • Escape of contaminants to the storm water or ground water table
    • Interference with site’s natural resources (i.e. flora, fauna, wildlife and ecosystems)
    • Noise and vibration from heavy machinery
    • Storm water and sediment run-off causing erosion or contamination
    • Vapour intrusion or release to the atmosphere
—————*
Here's the page URL: https://stg-oceanunderwriting-staging.kinsta.cloud/liability/
